fr.upmc.components.connectors

Interface ConnectorI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentImplementedI, RequiredI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DataConnectorI, DataTwoWayConnectorI, TwoWayConnectorI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConnector, AbstractDataConnector, AbstractDataTwoWayConnector, AbstractTwoWayConnector, ActiveDataConnector, ArrayBlockingQueueConnectionConnector, ArrayBlockingQueuePutConnector, ArrayBlockingQueueTakeConnector, CountDownLatchConnectionConnector, CountDownLatchConnector, CyclicBarrierConnectionConnector, CyclicBarrierConnector, DataConnector, DataTwoWayConnector, DynamicallyConnectableComponentConnector, DynamicComponentCreationConnector, DynamicConnectionRequestConnector, NGenerator2UGeneratorConnector, PairedGaugeConnector, SemaphoreConnectionConnector, SemaphoreConnector, SynchronizerManagerConnector, URIServiceConnector, URIServiceDynamicConnector

    public interface ConnectorI
extends RequiredI
    The interface ConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between requiring and offering components.

    Description

    Connectors are objects that are used to connect components through their required, offered and two-way interfaces. A connector first serves as a translator from calls using the required interface to the ones provided by the offered interface. It therefore implements a required interface by calling the corresponding methods in the offered interface. For two-way interfaces, connectors have to forward correctly the calls among the peers. Basically, a connector connects a requiring component to an offering one by implementing the requiring interface with methods that call the offering component through its corresponding offered interface. A connector therefore implements a mapping between the required and the offered interfaces. There is no limit to the number of required and offered interfaces that a component may use or implement.

    Created on : 2011-11-02

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

        boolean connected()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        test if this connector is already connected.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        true if already connected, false otherwise.

        java.lang.Exception

      • connect

        void connect(OfferedI offering,
           RequiredI requiring)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        connect a requiring component to a requiring one.

        Contract

         pre    offering != null && requiring != null
 pre    !this.connected()
 post   this.connected()
 post   ((PortI) requiring).connected()
 post   ((PortI) offering).connected()
        Parameters:
        offering - in port of the component implementing the offered interface.
        requiring - out port of the component requiring the required interface.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
